item.title: Does the new Council of Europe treaty on match-fixing comply with EU internal market regulations?
item.description: Tom Serby, a Senior Law Lecturer at Anglia Law School, Anglia Ruskin University, discusses the escalating problem of betting-related match-fixing in sports. He highlights the Council of Europe’s recent Convention aimed at tackling this issue, while also pointing out Malta’s legal challenge against it at the Court of Justice of the European Union (CJEU). Malta argues that the treaty clashes with internal market rules, particularly the freedom to provide services, underscoring the difficulties in achieving a unified international response to match-fixing.
